titles.title: Supporting the goals and ideals of National Volunteer Week.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Mr. Sablan moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 335.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Sablan objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote (2/3 required): 396 - 0 (Roll no. 209).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Healthy Families and Communities.

term.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

bill.summary:
4/27/2009--Passed House without amendment. Supports the goals and ideals of National Volunteer Week.
Recognizes the critical role of our national and community service programs.
Honors the contributions of all those hard-working American volunteers who make a difference in their communities every day of the year.
Invites all Americans to answer the call to serve through volunteerism in any form.
